# LLC Operating Agreement Template
## [COMPANY NAME] LLC - Delaware Limited Liability Company

---

**OPERATING AGREEMENT**

of

**[COMPANY NAME] LLC**

a Delaware Limited Liability Company

Effective Date: _____________, 20__

---

## ARTICLE I: FORMATION

### 1.1 Formation

The Company was formed as a Delaware limited liability company pursuant to the Delaware Limited Liability Company Act (6 Del. C. ยง 18-101 et seq.) (the "Act") upon the filing of a Certificate of Formation with the Delaware Secretary of State on _____________, 20__.

### 1.2 Name

The name of the Company is **[COMPANY NAME] LLC**.

### 1.3 Registered Agent and Office

The Company's registered agent and office in Delaware is:

**[Registered Agent Name]**  
[Address]  
[City], DE [ZIP]

### 1.4 Principal Office

The principal place of business of the Company shall be:

[Address]  
[City, State ZIP]

### 1.5 Term

The Company shall continue in existence until dissolved in accordance with this Agreement or the Act.

---

## ARTICLE II: PURPOSE

### 2.1 Purpose

The purpose of the Company is to:

**[For Management Company:]**
Provide investment management and advisory services to private investment funds, including [FUND NAME] LP, and to engage in any other lawful business for which a limited liability company may be organized under the Act.

**[For GP:]**
Serve as the general partner of [FUND NAME] LP and to exercise all rights and discharge all obligations of the general partner under the Limited Partnership Agreement.

---

## ARTICLE III: MEMBERS

### 3.1 Initial Members

The Members of the Company and their respective Percentage Interests are:

| Member Name | Capital Contribution | Percentage Interest |
|-------------|---------------------|---------------------|
| [Name 1] | $[Amount] | [XX]% |
| [Name 2] | $[Amount] | [XX]% |
| **Total** | **$[Total]** | **100%** |

### 3.2 Admission of New Members

Additional Members may be admitted only with the unanimous written consent of the existing Members.

### 3.3 Resignation

A Member may not voluntarily withdraw from the Company without the unanimous written consent of the other Members.

---

## ARTICLE IV: MANAGEMENT

### 4.1 Management by Members

The Company shall be managed by its Members in proportion to their Percentage Interests, unless otherwise unanimously agreed.

### 4.2 Managers (If Applicable)

- [ ] The Members hereby designate the following person(s) as Manager(s):

  **Manager:** [Name]  
  **Title:** Managing Member

### 4.3 Authority

The Manager(s) or Managing Member(s) shall have full authority to:

(a) Open and maintain bank accounts  
(b) Execute contracts in the Company's name  
(c) Hire employees and consultants  
(d) Make investment decisions on behalf of managed funds  
(e) File tax returns and regulatory filings  
(f) Take any action necessary for the Company's business

### 4.4 Limitations on Authority

Without the unanimous prior written consent of all Members, no Member or Manager may:

(a) Sell or dispose of all or substantially all Company assets  
(b) Merge or consolidate the Company  
(c) Amend this Operating Agreement (except as provided herein)  
(d) Admit new Members  
(e) Make a loan or guaranty exceeding $[Amount]  
(f) Cause the Company to file for bankruptcy

---

## ARTICLE V: CAPITAL CONTRIBUTIONS

### 5.1 Initial Contributions

The initial capital contributions of each Member are set forth in Section 3.1.

### 5.2 Additional Contributions

No Member shall be required to make additional capital contributions without that Member's consent.

### 5.3 Capital Accounts

A separate capital account shall be maintained for each Member in accordance with Treasury Regulation Section 1.704-1(b)(2)(iv).

### 5.4 No Interest

No interest shall be paid on capital contributions or capital accounts.

---

## ARTICLE VI: ALLOCATIONS AND DISTRIBUTIONS

### 6.1 Allocations of Profits and Losses

Except as otherwise required by the Code or Treasury Regulations, all items of income, gain, loss, deduction, and credit shall be allocated among the Members in proportion to their Percentage Interests.

### 6.2 Distributions

**[For Management Company - Fee Revenue:]**

Distributions shall be made at such times and in such amounts as determined by the Managing Member, but no less frequently than quarterly, in the following order of priority:

(a) First, to establish a reserve for anticipated Company expenses  
(b) Second, to the Members in proportion to their Percentage Interests

### 6.3 Tax Distributions

Prior to other distributions, the Company shall distribute to each Member an amount equal to the Member's allocable share of taxable income multiplied by the highest combined federal and state marginal income tax rate, less any prior distributions in such fiscal year.

---

## ARTICLE VII: MANAGEMENT FEES AND CARRIED INTEREST

**[For Management Company / GP Only]**

### 7.1 Management Fee

The Company shall receive from [FUND NAME] LP an annual management fee equal to:

- [ ] **[2]%** of Assets Under Management, paid quarterly in advance

### 7.2 Performance Allocation / Carried Interest

The Company (or the GP) shall receive a performance allocation equal to:

- [ ] **[20]%** of net profits above the high-water mark

### 7.3 Hurdle Rate (If Applicable)

- [ ] The performance allocation shall apply only to returns in excess of **[X]%** (the "Hurdle Rate")

### 7.4 Distribution of Incentive Compensation

Incentive compensation received by the Company shall be distributed to the Members in accordance with the following allocation:

| Member | Incentive Allocation |
|--------|---------------------|
| [Name 1] | [XX]% |
| [Name 2] | [XX]% |

---

## ARTICLE VIII: BOOKS, RECORDS, AND TAX MATTERS

### 8.1 Books and Records

The Company shall maintain complete and accurate books and records of account, which shall be maintained at the Company's principal office.

### 8.2 Fiscal Year

The fiscal year of the Company shall be the calendar year.

### 8.3 Tax Returns

The Company shall prepare and timely file all required federal and state tax returns. The Company shall furnish to each Member a Schedule K-1 within 90 days after the end of each fiscal year.

### 8.4 Tax Elections

The Company shall make the following tax elections:

(a) To elect under Section 754 of the Code (if requested by a Member)  
(b) To adopt an appropriate method of accounting  
(c) Such other elections as the Members may determine

### 8.5 Tax Matters Partner

[Name] shall serve as the "Partnership Representative" under Section 6223 of the Code.

---

## ARTICLE IX: TRANSFER OF INTERESTS

### 9.1 Restrictions on Transfer

No Member may sell, transfer, assign, pledge, or otherwise dispose of all or any part of such Member's Interest without the prior written unanimous consent of the other Members.

### 9.2 Right of First Refusal

Before any permitted transfer, the transferring Member must first offer the Interest to the other Members on the same terms.

### 9.3 Permitted Transfers

Notwithstanding Section 9.1, a Member may transfer Interests to:

(a) A trust for the benefit of the Member or immediate family  
(b) An entity wholly owned by the Member  
(c) A spouse pursuant to a divorce decree

---

## ARTICLE X: DISSOLUTION AND WINDING UP

### 10.1 Events of Dissolution

The Company shall dissolve upon:

(a) The unanimous written consent of the Members  
(b) The sale of all or substantially all Company assets  
(c) Entry of a decree of judicial dissolution  
(d) Any event that makes it unlawful to continue the Company's business

### 10.2 Winding Up

Upon dissolution, the Managing Member (or a liquidating trustee) shall wind up the Company's affairs and distribute assets in the following order:

(a) To creditors (including Members who are creditors)  
(b) To establish reserves for contingent liabilities  
(c) To Members in accordance with their capital account balances

---

## ARTICLE XI: INDEMNIFICATION

### 11.1 Indemnification

The Company shall indemnify each Member, Manager, and their affiliates from and against any losses arising from claims related to the Company's business, except to the extent caused by gross negligence, willful misconduct, or fraud.

### 11.2 Advance of Expenses

The Company may advance expenses to an indemnified party, subject to repayment if indemnification is ultimately determined to be improper.

---

## ARTICLE XII: MISCELLANEOUS

### 12.1 Entire Agreement

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Members relating to the Company.

### 12.2 Amendments

This Agreement may be amended only by the unanimous written consent of the Members.

### 12.3 Governing Law

This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware.

### 12.4 Severability

If any provision is held invalid, the remaining provisions shall continue in effect.

### 12.5 Counterparts

This Agreement may be executed in counterparts.

---

## SIGNATURES

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned have executed this Operating Agreement as of the date first written above.

**MEMBERS:**
